de.eckhartarnold.client

Class Fade

  • java.lang.Object
    • Animation
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.Fade

  •  class Fade
extends Animation
    Provides a special kind of animation that lets a widget fade in or fade out.
    Author:
    eckhart

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fade

        public Fade(Widget widget)
        Default constructor for class Fade. The default constructor takes the widget to fade as argument. Often, it is advisable to create the instance of the Fade class before the widget is added to DOM tree to avoid any jump cuts when fading in the widget.

        The default constructor assumes the fading to range from an opacity of 0.0 to 1.0. So, before any of the Animation.run methods is called the widget is invisible.

        Parameters:
        widget - the widget that is going to be faded in or out.

      • Fade

        public Fade(Widget widget,
    double from,
    double to)
        Constructor for class Fade. Takes the widget to fade as argument as well as the opacity range for fading. The opacity of the widget is immediately set to the beginning (from) of the range.
        Parameters:
        widget - the widget that is going to be faded in or out.
        from - opacity value to start with
        to - final opacity value

      • Fade

        public Fade(Widget widget,
    double from,
    double to,
    double threshold)
        Constructor for class Fade. Takes the widget to fade as argument as well as the opacity range for fading. The opacity of the widget is immediately set to the beginning (from) of the range.
        Parameters:
        widget - the widget that is going to be faded in or out.
        from - opacity value to start with
        to - final opacity value
        threshold - threshold, before opacity changes become visible

    • Method Detail

      • setOpacity

        public static void setOpacity(Widget widget,
              double opacity)
        Sets the opacity (i.e. translucency) of a widget to a specified value between 0.0 (invisible) and 1.0 (fully visible, i.e. not translucent).
        Parameters:
        widget - the widget the opacity of which is to be changed
        opacity - the opacity value ranging from 0.0 to 1.0

      • setCompleteOnCancel

        public void setCompleteOnCancel(boolean on)
        Turns completion of fading when fading is canceled on or off. If the parameter on is true, the opacity will be set to the target value when the animation is canceled (this is also the default behavior). Otherwise it will be left at its last value.
        Parameters:
        on - if true, completion on cancel is turned on.

      • setFadingSpan

        public void setFadingSpan(double from,
                 double to,
                 double threshold)
        Sets the range of opacity values over which the widget shall be faded. The opacity values must always be >= 0.0 and <= 1.0.
        Parameters:
        from - opacity when the fading begins
        to - final opacity of the widget when the fading ends
        threshold - threshold, before opacity changes become visible

      • changeOpacity

        protected void changeOpacity(double opacity)
        Changes the opacity and registers the new opacity level.
        Parameters:
        opacity - the new opacity of the imgae.
